vulnerabilities.recommendation: Upgrade to log4j-core 2.17.1 or later immediately

analysis.justification: Component is used in pricing engine which processes user input and logs extensively. JNDI lookup is enabled by default.
analysis.detail: CRITICAL: This vulnerability is actively exploited in the wild (KEV). Pricing engine is internet-facing and processes untrusted input. Immediate patching required. Temporary mitigation: Set log4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true

vulnerabilities.description: SSRF vulnerability in axios HTTP client

analysis.justification: Axios is only used for outbound requests to whitelisted partner APIs (Stripe, Experian). All URLs are hardcoded and not user-controllable.
analysis.detail: LOW PRIORITY: SSRF requires user-controlled URLs. Our implementation only makes requests to pre-configured partner endpoints. Scheduled for next maintenance window.

vulnerabilities.description: SQL injection in PostgreSQL client library

analysis.justification: PostgreSQL client is used throughout the application. Connection strings are partially constructed from environment variables which could be manipulated in certain deployment scenarios.
analysis.detail: HIGH PRIORITY: While connection strings are from env vars (not direct user input), this is still exploitable if env vars are compromised. Upgrade scheduled for this week.

vulnerabilities.description: Command injection in lodash template function

analysis.justification: Lodash is used only for utility functions (cloneDeep, merge, etc.). Template function is never called with user input.
analysis.detail: MEDIUM PRIORITY: Code review confirms lodash.template is not used anywhere in codebase. Only safe utility functions are used. Upgrade planned for next sprint.

vulnerabilities.description: Information disclosure in Stripe SDK error messages

analysis.justification: Stripe SDK is used for payment processing. Error messages are logged but logs are restricted to security team only.
analysis.detail: LOW PRIORITY: Error logs are not exposed to end users and are only accessible to authorized security personnel. Upgrade scheduled for Q1 2026.
